newsitem.title: USA: ABC Rail sees Q3 results below estimates.
newsitem.headline: ABC Rail sees Q3 results below estimates.

text.p: ABC Rail Products Corp said Wednesday results for its fiscal third quarter ending April 26 would be significantly below the consensus analyst estimate of $0.52 per share due to a number of operating factors that were temporarily depressing earnings.
In the same quarter last year, the company had a net loss of $2.5 million, or $0.30 per share.

D. Chisholm MacDonald, chief financial officer, told analysts attending an investor conference in New York that although orders were stronger than anticipated, a combination of factors were converging to hamper operations.
Among the factors were several facility and process upgrades designed to streamline ABC Rail's manufacturing operations and reduce costs, he said.
"Considering what's going on, the quarter won't be all that bad," he said in a company press statement. "But it certainly won't measure up to our earlier expectations or those of the Street."

MacDonald added that output was slowed at the company's Superior, Wis., and Newton, Kansas, trackwork plants and its Pueblo, Colo., and Chicago Heights, Ill., plants. He said the "complete re-design of track turnout products resulting from the recent large Western railroad mergers" had slowed the output.
"We have been slow in closing a money-losing plant acquired as part of our May 1996 acquisition of Deco Industries," MacDonald also said.
"Progress in bringing the recently re-built Calera wheel manufacturing plant up to speed also has been slower than anticipated," he added, according to the company.
The company's shares were down 2-5/8 to 14-3/4 in late trading Wednesday.
